title: Patriots elevate veteran RB D’Ernest Johnson ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Falcons
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Patriots elevated D'Ernest Johnson to the 53-man roster for Sunday's game against the Falcons due to injuries.
Rhamondre Stevenson is out with a toe injury, and Antonio Gibson is sidelined with a season-ending ACL injury.
Johnson, a seven-year NFL veteran, has experience as a running back and kick returner, offering versatility for the Patriots.

title: A new partnership between McAvoy, Zadorov has Bruins defense regaining some bite
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins' Charlie McAvoy and Nikita Zadorov form new defensive pairing, improving team performance in recent games.
In their last three games, the Bruins have tightened defensively, winning all three, with the new Zadorov-McAvoy pairing.
Zadorov's physical play allows McAvoy to be more aggressive offensively, as seen in their recent 2-1 win against Carolina.

title: How Jeremy Swayman responded after tweak in Bruins goalie rotation
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jeremy Swayman allowed one goal in a 2-1 win over Carolina, bouncing back after a tough loss to Ottawa.
Joonas Korpisalo started back-to-back games for the first time, posting a .933 save percentage in wins over the Islanders and Sabres.
Swayman leads Korpisalo with a .896 save percentage and 2.0 goals saved above expected despite recent rotation changes.

title: 9 things to know about Red Sox’ situation entering MLB offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Red Sox enter the offseason with a $218.92 million payroll, about $25 million below the luxury tax threshold.
Key players Dustin May, Rob Refsnyder, and Alex Bregman are expected to become free agents on Sunday.
Lucas Giolito could receive a $22.025 million qualifying offer, with club decisions on several player options due by Thursday.

title: CBS’s Jason McCourty has seen a lot of the Patriots this season, and even he didn’t see this level of success coming
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Jason McCourty will broadcast his third Patriots game of the regular season on Sunday alongside Charles Davis and Andrew Catalon.
The Patriots, led by quarterback Drake Maye, have surprised with a 6-2 record and Maye's MVP-level performances.
McCourty, a former Patriots defensive back, is an NFL analyst for CBS and ESPN, praising Maye's rapid improvement.

title: Patriots reportedly targeting Dolphins pass rusher ahead of trade deadline
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots are targeting Dolphins edge rusher Jaelan Phillips ahead of Tuesday's NFL trade deadline.
The Dolphins are seeking at least a third-round pick for Phillips, with several teams showing interest.
Phillips, recovering from a 2023 Achilles injury, ranks 11th in pressures and 13th in pass-rush win rate.

title: Marco Sturm: Bruins’ Mason Lohrei should be angry after getting scratched again
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bruins defenseman Mason Lohrei has been scratched for three consecutive games, remaining out of Saturday's lineup against the Hurricanes.
Coach Marco Sturm believes Lohrei should be frustrated with his benching, emphasizing it as a learning opportunity from the press box.
Lohrei's struggles in the defensive zone contributed to his scratch, while Hampus Lindholm and Nikita Zadorov strengthen Boston's defense.

title: 5 things to know about Falcons before Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Falcons, entering the game with a 3-4 record, aim to revive their playoff hopes against the Patriots.
Atlanta's QB Michael Penix struggles outdoors, with a 65.5 passer rating and winless record in outdoor stadium starts.
Falcons' defense ranks second in the league, allowing 275.6 yards per game, with a strong secondary led by A.J. Terrell.

title: Pair of former Red Sox save Dodgers to force Game 7 of World Series
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Mookie Betts hits a key two-run single, helping the Dodgers beat the Blue Jays 3-1 in World Series Game 6.
Kiké Hernandez makes a crucial defensive play, throwing out a Blue Jays runner to secure the Dodgers' win.
The Dodgers' victory forces a decisive Game 7, with hopes of repeating as World Series champions still alive.

title: Frights and delights: A look at some of Boston’s stand-out Halloween costumes
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: MBTA staff celebrated Halloween by distributing candy and stickers on the T, dressed as Wizard of Oz characters and a pirate.
Boston Police reported a SpongeBob SquarePants costume and a future cadet during East Boston's Trunk or Treat event.
At Boston Children's Hospital, Jayson Tatum encountered a Halloween surprise, while the Boston Parks showcased Fall-O-Ween Festival costumes.
